reg.title: Hotel Room Tax Regulation for the Tourism Rossland Society
reg.amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 209/2011, January 1, 2012]

section.sectiontext: In this regulation, Act means the Hotel Room Tax Act.
December 31, 2006 is the prescribed date after which section 3 of the Act applies in respect of accommodation purchased in the City of Rossland.
The tax payable under section 3 (1) of the Act is 2% of the purchase price of accommodation purchased in the City of Rossland.

section.marginalnote: Prescribed purpose for expenditure of tax
section.sectiontext: The Tourism Rossland Society may spend the amount paid to it out of the revenue collected from the tax for tourism marketing, programs and projects.
This regulation is repealed effective January 1, 2017.

content.regnote: Note: this regulation repeals B.C. Reg. 257/2001.

footnote.footnotetext: See section 45 of the Provincial Sales Tax Transitional Provisions and Amendments Act, 2013, S.B.C. 2013, c. 1

content.provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Hotel Room Tax Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 207, sections 3 and 43 (2) (e) and (f)]
